titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Asian Labor Resource Center Records WAG.126
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-07-07T14:59-0400

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect updated administrative information and name change

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The collection contains documents related to the New York City based organization Asia Labor Resource Center. It contain a number of research materials on Asian-American labor relations in New York City, Boston, and California. These materials consist of subject files; which include clippings, printed material and correspondence; relating to immigration, labor, women's issues, Asian student organizations, and health services. Other files in this collection contain minutes and administrative materials from the Asian Labor Resource Center, including materials relating to the First and Second Asian Labor Conferences at Cornell University (1988-1989). Many of the materials in this collection were created by Asian Labor Resource Center organizer and labor activist May Chen.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Chinese.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Asian Labor Resource Center Records; WAG 126; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives received a gift of the Chinese-American Labor and Immigration Collection in the late 1980s. These materials were most likely donated by the Asian Labor Resource Center, however, the provenance of this collection is unconfirmed. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.156.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains documents related to the New York City based organization Asia Labor Resource Center. It contain a number of research materials on Asian-American labor relations in New York City, Boston, and California. These materials consist of subject files; which include clippings, printed material and correspondence; relating to immigration, labor, women's issues, Asian student organizations, and health services. Other files in this collection contain minutes and administrative materials from the Asian Labor Resource Center, including materials relating to the First and Second Asian Labor Conferences at Cornell University (1988-1989). Many of the materials in this collection were created by Asian Labor Resource Center organizer and labor activist May Chen.
